events.title: Battle of Trafalgar
events.description: The British Royal Navy, under Admiral Horatio Nelson, decisively defeated the combined fleets of France and Spain, ensuring British naval supremacy.
events.significance: This battle prevented Napoleon's plans to invade Britain and established British naval dominance for over a century.

events.title: First Successful Electric Light Bulb Demonstration
events.description: Thomas Edison demonstrated the first practical incandescent light bulb that could be used commercially.
events.significance: This invention revolutionized indoor lighting and paved the way for widespread electrical illumination.

events.title: Che Guevara Captured in Bolivia
events.description: Revolutionary leader Che Guevara was captured by Bolivian forces assisted by the CIA.
events.significance: Marked the end of Guevara's attempts to incite revolution in South America and his subsequent execution made him an iconic figure.

events.title: Facebook Goes Public
events.description: Facebook held its initial public offering (IPO) on the NASDAQ stock exchange.
events.significance: Represented one of the largest technology IPOs in history, highlighting the rise of social media companies.
